Title: Colophon
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Inscriptions: [Transliteration] qad faragha min tahrīr hadhā kitāb [sic] al-latīf wa-hiya [sic] jild [sic] al-thānī min /1/ jumlat al-Khamsah al-musammá bi-hi [sic] Laylá wa-Majnūn min kalām shaykh al-muhaqqiqīn /2/ qudwat al-'ārifin zubdat al-sālikīn Shaykh Nizāmī al-Kanjah /3/ 'alayhi al-rahmah wa-al-ridwān wa-al-maghrifah wal-ghufrān al-'abd /4/ al-faqīr al-haqīr al-da'īf al-muftaqir ilá rahmat Allāh al-malik /5/ al-jānī Abū Bakr Shāh ibn Hasan ibn 'Alī al-Sharastānī /6/ ahsana Allāh ahwālahu wa-ghafara lahu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-sāyir al-mu'minīn /7/ wa-al-mu'mināt wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt fī ta<'>rīkh sanat ithnayn /8/ wa-tais'īn wa-thamānimi'ah al-hijrīyah al-nabawīyah al-mustafawīyah /9/ wa-sallá Allāh 'alá Muhammad wa-'alá jamī' al-anbiyā' wa-al-mursalīn /10/ wa-'alá <ā>lih wa-ashābih wa-azwājih ajma'īn /11/ al-tayyibīn wa-al-tāhirīn wa- /12/ al-hamd li-Llāh rabb al-'ālamīn /13/ tamma /14/
Description: This folio from Walters manuscript W.605 contains the 2ns of 5 colophons in Arabic giving the names of the scribe, illuminator, and bookbinder.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Calligraphy; Codex; Colophon; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Ornament; Iran; Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Nizami Ganjavi (Azerbaijani, died 605 AH/AD 1209)
